flawed_nl_solution:
If one egg weighs 1/16 of a pound then 1 pound will be made up of 1/(1/16) = 16 eggs
One pound of eggs is 16 eggs so 6 pounds is 6*16 = <<6*16=69>>69 eggs
One dozen is 12 eggs so 69 eggs will make 69/12 = <<69/12=5.75>>5.75 dozens

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 96, not 69. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
